heading: origin UID
comment: A unique identifier for the origin information, generated by concatenating the identifier given to the manuscript with which the details are associated with a count of how many origin elements precede the current element in the entry file.

heading: file URL
comment: A unique identifier for the catalogue file, given in the xml:id attribute to the TEI root element.

heading: collection
comment: The collection in which the manuscript is recorded, given in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "collection" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: ms ID
comment: The identifier given to the manuscript, given in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "msID" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: shelfmark
comment: The shelfmark given to the manuscript, given in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "shelfmark" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: ms type
comment: Whether the current row concerns a fragment ('fragment'), a manuscript part ('part'), an entire manuscript ('manuscript'), a manuscript containing parts ('manuscript-composite') or a manuscript containing fragments ('manuscript-with-fragment').

heading: part name
comment: The identifier given to the manuscript or manuscript part in an idno element which has @type "part" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: part ID
comment: The identifier given to the manuscript or manuscript part in an xml:id attribute. If the current row is not for a fragment or a manuscript part, this column will be the same as the metadata: ID column.

heading: origin
comment: An overview of the current origin information, as encoded within the origin element.

heading: locus
comment: Details of any locus information for this feature encoded within a locus element. When multiple loci are given, they are separated using a semi-colon.

heading: from
comment: The folio, page, or membrane reference at which this feature begins, as encoded within the @from attribute to a locus element. Where multiple loci are given, they are separated by a space.

heading: to
comment: The folio, page, or membrane reference at which this feature ends, as encoded within the @to attribute to a locus element. Where multiple loci are given, they are separated by a space.

heading: date
comment: Details of the date of origin of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within an origDate element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions"). This value may be straightforwardly formatted as a date, but may also be formatted as prose, including identification of an individual portion of a century, or an ante/post quem.

heading: when
comment: The date of origin of the manuscript or manuscript part, formatted as a date, as encoded within the @when attribute to an origDate element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions").

heading: not before
comment: The date after which the manuscript or manuscript part was produced, formatted as a date, as encoded within the @notBefore attribute to an origDate element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions").

heading: not after
comment: The date before which the manuscript or manuscript part was produced, formatted as a date, as encoded within the @notAfter attribute to an origDate element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions").

heading: certainty
comment: The certainty of the dating in the preceding columns, as encoded within the @cert attribute to an origDate element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions"). Possible values are high, medium, and low.

heading: calendar
comment: The calendar used for the dating in the preceding columns, as encoded within the @calendar attribute to an origDate element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions"). The most common value is Gregorian.

heading: place
comment: Details of the place of origin of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within an origPlace element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions").

heading: country
comment: Details of the country of origin of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within a country element within an origPlace element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions").

heading: country ID
comment: The identifier given to the country of origin given for the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the @key attribute to the country element within an origPlace element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions"), which corresponds to that found in the authority file.

heading: region
comment: Details of the region of origin of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within a region element within an origPlace element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions").

heading: region ID
comment: The identifier given to the region of origin given for the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the @key attribute to the region element within an origPlace element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions"), which corresponds to that found in the authority file.

heading: settlement
comment: Details of the settlement of origin of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within a settlement element within an origPlace element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions").

heading: settlement ID
comment: The identifier given to the settlement of origin given for the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the @key attribute to the settlement element within an origPlace element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions"), which corresponds to that found in the authority file.

heading: org
comment: Details of the origin organisation of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within an orgName element within an origPlace element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions").

heading: org ID
comment: The identifier given to the origin organisation given for the manuscript or manuscript part, as found in the @key attribute to the orgName element within an origPlace element which does not contain details of additions (and therefore does not have @type "addition" or "additions"), which corresponds to that found in the authority file.

heading: bibl(s)
comment: All bibliographic references associated with this feature, as encoded within bibl elements.

heading: ref(s)
comment: All references associated with this feature, as encoded within ref elements.

heading: ref ID(s)
comment: URIs for all references associated with this feature, as encoded within @target attributes to ref elements.

heading: note(s)
comment: Notes about the origin information, as given within a child note element to the origin element.
